channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The Dial-A-Poem art installation can now reach listeners worldwide on the internet
item.description: Poet and performance artist John Giorno launched Dial-a-Poem in the 1960s to deliver random poems over the phone. Now, a group continues his work on a new medium -- the internet.
item.content:encoded: Poet and performance artist John Giorno launched Dial-a-Poem in the 1960s to deliver random poems over the phone. Now, a group continues his work on a new medium -- the internet.
item.dc:creator: Kai McNamee

item.title: New York's city council looks to ban Central Park horse-drawn carriages
item.description: New York City has long argued over whether to ban the horse-drawn carriages that ferry tourists around Central Park and other sites. Now, it looks like the horses may at last be put out to pasture.
item.content:encoded: New York City has long argued over whether to ban the horse-drawn carriages that ferry tourists around Central Park and other sites. Now, it looks like the horses may at last be put out to pasture.
item.dc:creator: Walter Wuthmann

item.title: The federal government ends funding for an ambitious AI project
item.description: The Trump administration has pledged to invest in artificial intelligence. Yet a promising program that uses AI to solve weather-related problems lost funding from the National Science Foundation.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration has pledged to invest in artificial intelligence. Yet a promising program that uses AI to solve weather-related problems lost funding from the National Science Foundation.
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Jewish activist and leader Rabbi Arthur Waskow dies at 92
item.description: Rabbi Arthur Waskow, noted Jewish activist and author of The Freedom Seder, has died at the age of 92. He spent nearly six decades writing, teaching and changing the shape of American Jewish practice.
item.content:encoded: Rabbi Arthur Waskow, noted Jewish activist and author of The Freedom Seder, has died at the age of 92. He spent nearly six decades writing, teaching and changing the shape of American Jewish practice.
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep

item.title: YouTube chess superstar Daniel Naroditsky, 29, has died
item.description: American chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky died this week at 29 years old — just two weeks shy of his 30th birthday. His peers remember him as humble despite his immense skill.
item.content:encoded: American chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky died this week at 29 years old — just two weeks shy of his 30th birthday. His peers remember him as humble despite his immense skill.
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: 'Racebook' author Tochi Onyebuchi misses the old internet
item.description: Remember when the internet was simple? A little less violent? In his new book Racebook, Tochi Onyebuchi hearkens back to the early days of the internet, how fun it was, and when everything changed.
item.content:encoded: Remember when the internet was simple? A little less violent? In his new book Racebook, Tochi Onyebuchi hearkens back to the early days of the internet, how fun it was, and when everything changed.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: Actor and author Nick Offerman reflects on a place that shaped him
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Actor and author Nick Offerman reflects on a place that shaped him.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Actor and author Nick Offerman reflects on a place that shaped him.

item.title: Houses of worship grapple with financial and emotional impacts of government shutdown
item.description: What does the government shutdown mean for the financial stability of houses of worship in the DC area? And how are clergy ministering to those affected?
item.content:encoded: What does the government shutdown mean for the financial stability of houses of worship in the DC area? And how are clergy ministering to those affected?
item.dc:creator: Adelle Banks

item.title: Mamdani rise in NYC mayor's race reflects generational rifts in the Democratic Party
item.description: Zohran Mamdani, age 34, is on track to topple Andrew Cuomo who's been Democratic Party royalty for decades. Analysts say Mamdani's hopeful appeals to young voters on social media shook up the race.
item.content:encoded: Zohran Mamdani, age 34, is on track to topple Andrew Cuomo who's been Democratic Party royalty for decades. Analysts say Mamdani's hopeful appeals to young voters on social media shook up the race.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: How Trump uses 'common sense' to make a political point
item.description: The idea of "common sense" has been central to American politics since the founding of the United States. Politicians still use the phrase all the time -- perhaps none more so than Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded: The idea of "common sense" has been central to American politics since the founding of the United States. Politicians still use the phrase all the time -- perhaps none more so than Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben
